There are a lot of things that I really enjoyed about staying the two nights at this airbnb.
There were welcome snacks and two Sprites. Inside the nice large refrigerator there were several bottles of water, and the ice maker was very good. The television was awesome and very easy to use. The key code was very easy to remember. There were many towels, hand towels, and wash cloths to use. They have large capacity washer and dryer, iron, ironing board, even laundry baskets. The plug for the internet was very near the bed which made it easy to use. The ceiling fans in most rooms were wonderful and the air conditioning was perfect. In the bathroom, they had cotton balls, q-tips, and name-brand shampoo and conditioner. It has a nice front porch and a small screened in back porch. The bathroom door is a barn door and even under the vanity there is a tiny barn door to open it. As you can tell, I really enjoyed my stay. And the host was wonderful. I could not have been more happy.

My family and I come to this area of Arkansas once or twice a year to visit family. This is, by far, the nicest place we've ever stayed around there. The cabin is spacious and fantastic. It had all the amenities we could ask for and more (horse shoe pit, tetherball pole, darts, pool table, cards, puzzles, board games, bubbles for the kids, a pit boss smoker for the adultier kids). It had more than enough sleeping space for everyone and had enough space and seating that we could have invited our whole extended family out to relax and visit for a while.
My kids loved the nature surrounding the cabin. They watched fireflies from the porches, counted stars from the deck overlooking the river, and we even got to watch a red fox come up from the river and meander back into the woods.
We definitely look forward to booking this cabin again in the future.
**My only word of caution for future renters is something that I had to remind my children several times. We're in a cabin out in the woods, overlooking a beautiful river. There will be bugs. We had several dirt daubers make it into the cabin, saw a couple of spiders, and had some moths and flying insects that would surround our bedside lamps at night. This was not a problem for us, because it's to be expected in a setting like this. I just wanted to include the caution in the event some people just really don't like bugs.
